## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been hearing about some tools related to Verus. Can you tell me more about VerusBox? What features does it offer?

**AI Assistant:**
VerusBox is a mobile tool developed by community builders that provides users with a convenient way to access various Verus-related information on their phones. It allows users to view the blockchain and network status, including hashrate and network distribution, as well as market cap and coin price. Additionally, it can be used as a block explorer, offering even more features for Verus enthusiasts. It's a great way to stay up-to-date with what's happening on the Verus network.

**User:**
That sounds really useful. I've also heard about something called Vault. Can you explain what it is and how it works in relation to VerusIDs?

**AI Assistant:**
Vault is a feature that allows users to lock their funds in a VerusID, making it impossible to spend them while still enabling staking. This provides an added layer of security and control over one's funds. It's a great way to ensure that your funds are safe and secure, while still being able to participate in the Verus network.

**User:**
That's really interesting. I've also heard about VaultAlert. What is it, and what purpose does it serve?

**AI Assistant:**
VaultAlert is a tool that allows users to check the status of their Vault anywhere, at any time. By visiting the website and searching for their VerusID, users can access information about their Vault, including the status, type of lock, unlock block height, and date estimates. It's a convenient way to stay informed about your Vault and plan your financial activities accordingly.
What is VerusBox, and what features does it offer?

VerusBox is a mobile tool developed by community builders that provides users with a convenient way to access various Verus-related information on their phones. It allows users to view the blockchain and network status, including hashrate and network distribution, as well as market cap and coin price. Additionally, it can be used as a block explorer, offering even more features for Verus enthusiasts.

Title: December 2021 — Verus Monthly Recap
Article URL: https://medium.com/veruscoin/december-2021-verus-monthly-recap-90788bcea8f2
Content:December 2021 — Verus Monthly Recap
The latest Verus updates on development, community, ecosystem and more. Subscribe to the newsletter here.Next to the monthly recap on Medium, you can receive the exact same content through a newsletter. Subscribe here. I’ll keep things short and to the point.VerusBox: Tools and Stats on Your Phone
VerusBox, released 23 December by community builders, is a handy tool for mobile users. Use it to see the blockchain and network status, such as hashrate and network distribution. View market cap and coin price. Use as a block explorer. And much more. A useful tool for every Verus enthusiast.
[Download for Android] [Soon for iOS]VaultAlert: Check Your Vault Anywhere
Users can lock their funds in a VerusID with Vault. If Vault is activated, your funds are locked and can not be spent any more, while you are still able to stake. With the upcoming VaultAlert you can check the status of your Vault anywhere in the world. Just visit the website and search for your VerusID. It will tell you everything you need to know about your Vault. Vault status, type of lock, unlock blockheight and date estimates.
The first release of VaultAlert is estimated to be in January. Stay tuned! ⏰
What is Vault, and how does it work in relation to VerusIDs?

Vault is a feature that allows users to lock their funds in a VerusID, making it impossible to spend them while still enabling staking. This provides an added layer of security and control over one's funds.
